title: Integrate SAM with Raynet
content:
This page describes how to integrate SAM with Raynet catalog using UCMDB to strengthen compliance, cost optimization, and software asset lifecycle governance.

Integration benefits

By integrating UCMDB with RayVentory Catalog, SAM gains access to significantly improved software inventory data. Key benefits include:

  • Enriched Software Metadata:

    • Release Date: Tracks when a software version was launched, which is referred to as General availability in SAM.
    • End of Life Date: Indicates when vendor support ends.
    • Obsolete Date: Indicates when software becomes non-viable.
  • Lifecycle-Aware License Management:
    • Enables creation of a license compatibility matrix  based on software release timelines.
    • Supports informed decisions around renewals, upgrades, and decommissioning.
    • Enhances accuracy in dashboards, compliance reports, and license tracking.

Prerequisites

Before you begin, complete the following prerequisites:

  • UCMDB is integrated with Raynet and actively receiving normalized inventory. For more information on how to integrate UCMDB with Raynet, see Integrate UD with Raynet One.
  • Integrate SAM with UCMDB. To do this, see Enable the SAM capability - Service Management.
  • Configure UCMDB to consume Normalized Software information RayVentory Catalogue data.
  • Support for Raynet is available from ESM 25.4 onwards.

Use case

This use case describes the implementation of an automated lifecycle and compatibility analysis framework that leverages enriched metadata from UCMDB through Raynet integration.

Enriched data consumption from UCMDB

  • The system fetches product version data from UCMDB.
  • Raynet enriches this data with lifecycle dates: General Availability (GA), End of Life (EOL), Extended End of Life.
  • These fields are displayed in:
    • Product Version Grid
    • Imported Product Version Grid

Auto-Build compatibility matrix based on GA date

  • The system uses GA dates instead of version strings to determine compatibility.
  • This avoids issues with non-standard version formats (for example, vNext, 2023.R2, etc.).
  • Compatibility rules are applied based on chronological GA dates:
    • Products released within a compatible window are marked as interoperable.
    • Matrix is auto-generated and visualized for user review.

New lifecycle reports in Service Management dashboard

  • A new report section is added: Lifecycle Phase Analysis which is Software versions by product lifecycle phase and List of software products with lifecycle phase.
  • Products are categorized based on lifecycle dates:
    • ACTIVE: Between GA and EOL (or before EOL if GA is missing)
    • LIMITED: Between EOL and OBS
    • OBSOLETE: After OBS (if no LC date available)
    • UNKNOWN: If any lifecycle date is missing
  • List of software products with lifecycle phase refers to a catalog or inventory of software applications, tools, or platforms, each annotated with its current lifecycle phase. This helps organizations track the status, support level, and strategic relevance of each software product.

SAM reporting enhancements

To view the reporting enhancements from the Mega Menu go to Software Asset > SAM > Analysis > Product Lifecycle Analysis.
  • Reports use new phase labels: ACTIVE, LIMITED, OBSOLETE, UNKNOWN.
  • Filters and visualizations allow users to:
    • Identify products nearing EOL or OBS.
    • Plan upgrades or replacements.
    • Track lifecycle compliance.
